name: Edward ANSKIS, Appellant, v. Selma FISCHER and Louis Fischer and Michael Lenahan and Sears, Roebuck & Company

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
parties: Edward ANSKIS, Appellant, v. Selma FISCHER and Louis Fischer and Michael Lenahan and Sears, Roebuck & Company.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
LARSEN, J., dissents.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM

attorneys: Sheldon A. Goodstadt, Harry J. Oxman, Philadelphia, for appellant.
James M. Marsh, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
490 A.2d 437
Edward ANSKIS, Appellant, v. Selma FISCHER and Louis Fischer and Michael Lenahan and Sears, Roebuck & Company.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 15, 1985.
Decided April 23, 1985.
Sheldon A. Goodstadt, Harry J. Oxman, Philadelphia, for appellant.
James M. Marsh, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
